teal module for Kaplan-Meier Plot from grid

tm_g_km.Rd

This is teal module produces a grid style KM plot for data with ADaM structure

tm_g_km(label, dataname, arm_var, arm_ref_comp = NULL, paramcd,
  facet_var, strata_var, plot_height = c(1200, 400, 5000),
  tbl_fontsize = 8,
  pre_output = helpText("x-axes for different factes may not have the same scale"),
  post_output = NULL)

Arguments

label

menue item label of the module in the teal app
dataname

(character) analysis data used in teal module, needs to be available in the list passed to the data argument of init. Note that the data is expected to be in vertical form with the PARAMCD variable filtering to one observation per patient.
arm_var

choices_selected object with all available choices and preselected option for variable names that can be used as arm_var
arm_ref_comp

(choices_selected) optional, if specified it must be a named list with each element corresponding to an arm variable in ASL and the element must be another list with the elements named ref and comp that the defined the default reference and comparison arms when the arm variable is changed.
paramcd

choices_selected object with all available choices and preselected option for variable names that can be used as PARAMCD variable
facet_var

choices_selected object with all available choices and preselected option for variable names that can be used for facet plotting
strata_var

choices_selected object with all available choices and preselected option for variable names that can be used for stratification
plot_height

vector with three elements defining selected, min and max plot height
tbl_fontsize

fontsize for text annotation
pre_output

optional, shiny.tag with text placed before the output to put the output into context. For example the helpText elements are useful.
post_output

optional, shiny.tag with text placed before the output to put the output into context. For example the helpText elements are useful.

Examples

library(random.cdisc.data)

ASL <- radsl(seed = 1)
ATE <- radtte(ASL, seed = 1)

keys(ASL) <- keys(ATE) <- c("USUBJID", "STUDYID")
#> Error in keys(ATE) <- c("USUBJID", "STUDYID"): could not find function "keys<-"

arm_ref_comp <- list(
  ARM = list(
    ref = "A: Drug X",
    comp = c("B: Placebo", "C: Combination")
  ),
  ARMCD = list(
    ref = "ARM B",
    comp = "ARM A"
  )
)

app <- init(
  data = cdisc_data(
    ASL = ASL, ATE = ATE,
    code = "ASL <- radsl(seed = 1)
            ATE <- radtte(ASL, seed = 1)
            keys(ASL) <- keys(ATE) <- c('USUBJID', 'STUDYID')",
    check = FALSE
  ),
  modules = root_modules(
    tm_g_km(
      label = "KM PLOT",
      dataname = "ATE",
      arm_var = choices_selected(c("ARM", "ARMCD"), "ARM"),
      arm_ref_comp = arm_ref_comp,
      paramcd = choices_selected(c("OS", "PFS"), "OS"),
      facet_var = choices_selected(c("SEX", "BMRKR2"), "BMRKR2"),
      strata_var = choices_selected(c("SEX", "BMRKR2"), "SEX"),
      tbl_fontsize = 12
    )
  )
)
#> Error in cdisc_data(ASL = ASL, ATE = ATE, code = "ASL <- radsl(seed = 1)\n            ATE <- radtte(ASL, seed = 1)\n            keys(ASL) <- keys(ATE) <- c('USUBJID', 'STUDYID')",     check = FALSE): Argument in not of class dataset, please use cdisc_dataset function!
if (FALSE) {
shinyApp(ui = app$ui, server = app$server)
}
